Got a 90 minute couples massage from Groupon for like $130 I think. This is the third massage I have gotten. We came in for our 12:30 appointment like at 12:20 and we were led inside after filing out some questionnaire that asked about preferences. The massage ended at exactly 2:00pm so we got our scheduled 90 minutes including the time to change in the beginning. I would come back since it was a good experience for the price. The massage included a bit of hot stones and the massage beds were warm and it was cozy. Overall good experience! Recommend üëç
Parking does suck but it sucks everywhere in this area. We didn‚Äôt struggle too much with it though we only looked for like 5 minutes. Also receptionist was very friendly !<//Review>

After purchasing the Groupon booking my appointment was a little frustrating but it got figured out. I scheduled a later time (I was their last customer). A lot of people on here complain about the parking. I had no trouble finding parking but this is Hollywood so parking will be a hit or miss. My first time at this place my massage was 90 minutes. Was instantly greeted when I walked in. They kept calling me to come in a little earlier but I was driving but I did manage to arrive 20 minutes early. I undressed then Amy walked in. <Text>The staff is pathetic. We had an appointment and missed it because my daughter had an emergency at the hospital. Obviously our thoughts were not on any appointments at the time. The Amazon local deal we purchased did say they had the option of forfeiting the voucher and of course they did not hesitate to do that. So they took our money and we got NOTHING in return. I called to explain but the receptionist made it clear she did not care and was actually laughing on the phone while saying I am not sure what you want me to do. I said, can you not even give us the value of what we paid towards services and she said no, why didn't you call us? AFTER I had already explained my daughter was in the hospital. I guess they expected me to forget about her and either go to my appointment or rewind time to give 24 hours notice.

Either way, they made it obvious that they are more than happy to take money people work hard to earn and give nothing in return. ZERO service. I would have been fine getting the face value out of it considering it was an emergency that could not have been planned. All I got was laughed at.

I do not recommend ANYONE go here. The service was the worst I ever encountered anywhere. I have heard of employees laughing at customers but never experienced it first hand. There are enough options available at places that treat their customers better. Sparadise doesn't care at all about theirs. Money for nothing is what they want. Enjoy ours you will not get anymore of it.

UPDATE: Amazon as always stepped up to the plate and refunded the voucher. Amazon does customer service right, this "Spa" could learn a lot. I still say avoid it, they are rude.

Also notice, they voted for themselves so with only 3 ratings it is hugely impacted by their FALSE vote. This place is a total joke.<//Text></record>

<Text>First of all, I'm upset I'm even required to leave 1 star in order to write this review. I have never written a review for any business on Yelp before, but my experience was so outrageous that I am compelled to now. My mom has been here at least twice and has had fairly good experiences. We had two vouchers for 90 minute massages and decided since I was in town for the day to have a nice mother daughter spa day. So at 10:30 am this morning, my mom and I booked two massages for 4PM. On our drive there we hit some traffic and called at 2:30 to see if we could push back the appointments to 4:15. The receptionist said it wasn't possible so we said we'd do our best to be there at 4, she said ok. We beat traffic and arrive at 4PM, after driving 80, YES EIGHTY, miles to get there. After sitting for a while and filling out all the paperwork we are told that our appointments were for 1PM and that we missed them. We tell her she is wrong and has made a mistake and she goes back to her computer clicking around while we sit and have no idea if we're getting massages now or not. She comes back and again keeps repeating that our appointments were at 1. She insists she tried calling us over and over again to confirm the appointment yet we have no missed calls or voicemails from her. I bring up the point that when we spoke to her at 2:30PM she made no mention of us missing our appointment and even said she'd see us as soon as we could get there. She had no response to me pointing this out and instead continued to repeat that our appointments were at 1. She would not apologize and would not admit she made a mistake. She eventually found 2 available masseuses, but one of them was not with the person we specifically requested. Given that at this point we had already missed almost 15 minutes of our massage and she had given no apology whatsoever, we thought it only right that the 2nd massage be on the house. She said she would not do that so we instead asked for a refund. She said she could not do that because she didn't have the cash. The place is a cash only store.... When I pointed this out she said she didn't have the power to give a refund. We asked her to call her boss and for about 5-10 minutes and she straight up refused and said she had no way of calling him. Finally another person came out and said right away that they could call the boss. We spoke to the boss and explained the situation and he asked to speak to the receptionist, they spoke for about 5-10 minutes, again with us having no idea what was happening and wasting our time. Finally she gave us our money back. Still with no apology. We drove 80 miles for this to have a nice day on my 1 day in town visiting from the east coast and instead we left more tense than before we even scheduled the massages. Although the owner did the right thing in the end, it was the most unbelievable customer service I have ever witnessed or experienced. And truthfully, had she acknowledged and apologized for her mistake and our inconvenience we would have happily accepted the two appointments and paid for them with our vouchers as planned, even with the massage therapist we did not schedule with. But instead, because of the unbelievably poor customer service, we will be driving another 80 miles home for nothing other than a horribly un relaxing experience. My mom will never schedule another massage here out of fear that she will drive for hours only to find she has no appointment. it was unbelievable and such a disappointment.<//Text>< user_name>
Tenaya Cowsill</user_name>

If you have a schedule that you need to keep I would NOT RECOMMEND THESE GUYS AT ALL!!  I OWN A LANDSCAPING COMPANY CALLED CUTTING EDGE.
Okay so I go to order decomposed granite and flagstone for a customer. I was able to order the decomposed granite the same day but the flagstone was coming in later that week according to the guy at the front desk who took my payment for the decomposed granite. We did not hear from them for the rest of the week so we called the following Monday and again they told us it would be in that week so now I'm waiting another week for the flagstone. Come Friday I have not heard back from affordable Rock so we give them a call and they tell us it will be in by lunch time. Still did not hear back from them all day so we call again at the end of Friday and they tell us it should be in by the morning. it is now Monday morning and they are not answering my calls. This is very bad business and customer service and it makes other businesses look bad that have jobs lined up. I would not recommend using these guys if you have a schedule that you need to keep.<//Review>

<text>An imaginative reconsideration of what a hot dog can be.  Was it Mexican, as the name implies?  Well, maybe.  But regardless, it was good.  A very tasty hot dog loaded with onions and peppers, avocado and several sauces.  The fries were also reimagined in a similar way.  And equally tasty.  Just across the street from the beach and one of the least expensive meals on that street.  I don't think you'll be disappointed.< /text>< username>

Peter Petey Pete<//user_name>
<date>1504685377873<//date>< rating>
5< /rating>
<review>Hotdogs and Beer!

You'll be lucky to find a bar where they offer a single hotdog on their menu. This place has 5 different ones! With a choice of classic dog or gourmet sausage, along with many other hotdog centric appetizers, there is bound to be something to satisfy your hotdog craving. They also offer other traditional bar food as well.

I ordered the Sonoran and Carnitas classic with a side of tots. Both were great but don't order two. One is plenty to get full from. The toppings are served high atop a large classic style dog wrapped in bacon placed in soft grilled bun. The bacon could probably have been cooked a little longer for my preference. The bun was perfect, almost as soft as a Hawaiian roll.

The tots were great! Really crispy/crunchy and seasoned with a spiced fine salt.

Service was very friendly, attentive and fast.

I will definitely return to try their gourmet sausage and a pint of beer during a ballgame.< /review><pictures>[{'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipPGjjYLafp3FvZIMtw1CehN5bP7ryqlmtEBKFNf=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipO75W9EyMeaPjGEun3wv2Zf0nG3XjuZdo-8ruKY=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipO0O2juFtiIREnoUZgNcpu33WG5CzDSAGI8kBtU=w150-h150-k-no-p']}]<//pictures>< Resp>

< Text>
My company hired Doggos Gus for our anniversary picnic this year and everything was absolutely great. We had tacos, street corn, bacon-wrapped dogs & churros for about 100 people. They brought 2 set-ups and about 10 employees making it super easy for everyone to grab food quickly. In addition, only 2 drinks were included in the package we purchased, however, Gustavo and his team brought all 3 available drinks and kept everything topped off. Everyone was super pleased with the food & the quality of the services rendered. Will definitely consider them for any future events.</Text>

<Text>I attended a Yelp Brewventure at The Lost Abbey and got to taste Doggos Gus hot dog for the first time, mind blown, it reminded me DINERS, DRIVE-INS AND DIVES show from Food network. Thanks to these guys for the catering, they took the event to the next level. I would recommend them for the catering for any event, Kids birthday party to Superbowl party.

Doggus Gus was on Fire, making on of the best hot dogs in the town. I will call them for my next catering need. Their bacon wrapped hotdogs was worth standing in the line again and again :)

These hot dogs taste so good, especially with great beer. The caters working non-stop for hours tireless with super energy. I plan on booking them for our next event and praying that my next event will have them :)

<text>Based on safety, NO WAY! I will not refer anyone to this Avis location. While driving away not even 4 feet from parking space the tire rolled off the front left side of the car and as my husband put the car in park we were shocked and in disbelief to see that the tire had just rolled off the vehicle. We got out of the car we noticed the tire on the front right was bent and just about to come off too. When the mechanic or the guy that cleans the cars noticed what had happened he asked us, ‚Äùdidnt you not see the tires loose before driving off, ‚Äù as if it was our fault that this happened. I mean when one rents a car from a reputable company you trust and believe you are in good hands. The last thing we thought of before getting into the car after inspecting for minor dents or scratches is to check the tires to see if all the bolts are on each tire. That's not our job. What rental company expects their customers to check if the tires are bolted and safe before getting in the car! Ridiculous! The car is suppose to be inspected before your customers drive off. Had my husband drove off the lot and on to the streets and this happened, there is no telling what physical damage or horrible accident this could have caused. We've been renting from this location for a long time because we like the main guy who handles the paperwork. He‚Äôs very knowledgeable of travel destinations and refers you to a lot of nice places him and his wife have travelled to, but this was not about customer service. This is about one's safety. Making sure my family is safe when driving one of Avis cars. Yes, we went ahead with the reservations and we were given another car, because we needed a car and had to get on the road to be on time for our travel plans. But even the second car that was given to us was a good car and good on gas, but when we'd park the car and get out of the vehicle there was a burning smell. Not sure what that was, but again it put a doubt in my mind if we were going to have a problem with getting back home safely. üëé<//text>< pics>

< Review>
Been going there for years. Not a lot of Chinese places in Escondido. This is mostly American style Chinese, but you can find something you like even if not authentic. Usually fast service. Higher priced than many Chinese places. We only go there if we don't want to drive further. I really like the dining room ambience.</Review>

<UserId.>117976482403010685498<//UserId.><user_name>Veronica Castaneda</user_name><Time>1583603895965< /Time><Rating>2<//Rating>< review>
I've came here a few times and finally decided to rate it. Their drinks arent very good. The icecream is okay the only thing is it has lots of pieces of ice from the freezer around it and it affects the icecreams taste. I've gotten the tostiloco and each time it's been good & so has their fruit! The main reason I am upset about this place is because of being robbed at times. 3 times I went here the lady overcharged me. The first time I spoke up and she gave me the difference. The second I was just kinda weirded out it happened again but I didnt say anything cause it was only a dollar. I did notice this happened late at night close to closing each time so I dont know if she tries to sneak away with an extra little charge or is just tired. The third time I didnt argue about the extra 2 dollar overcharge I was over it and just figured oh well keep it but she lost a customer over it.<//review>

< Text>
If you're looking to play on a golf course that is more challenging than most courses in the LA area than this is the one. Try it out and see for yourself. Good luck.</Text>
< pictures>
None<//pictures>
<Resp>None< /Resp>< GmapID>
0x80c2d34468b5a76d:0x9c3743f648fc1303<//GmapID>
</record></dataset><record>
<text>Super impressed with this course.  Greens are very receptive, tee boxes and fairways in good shape, and the layout is interesting.  The front 9 and back 9 also felt like 2 different courses so it's challenging. Facilities are clean. Range balls are always new and unlimited.  Two putting greens, one flat, one undulating.  And a short game area that is great.  I've had dinner there twice, and I've enjoyed the food at the restaurant.  Service is always polite and professional .  Also, best chips and salsa I've ever had.  The snack shop has great hot dogs and cool drinks.  They allow daily play on Mondays but for the most part it is a private club.  Every member I've met truly loves the club, and I can understand why.< /text>< pictures>
None</pictures>

<text>Super friendly service, great food</text></record>
</dataset><record>
<Name>Thizzelle Washington<//Name><gmapID>0x80c2d34468b5a76d:0x9c3743f648fc1303</gmapID><Text>Been a member here for about a year and can't recommend it enough. The course is always in flawless condition (the greens are fast!) but the best part of all is the lack of crowds. You almost never need to make a tee time and the biggest selling point for me is that I can count on playing a 3.5 - 4 hour round every time I come out and if I am playing by myself it takes me just over 3 hours.

I would recommend this club to anyone. I was surprised how affordable it was. I pay $425/month and get to play unlimited rounds of golf. I was definitely spending more than that to play my local muni courses and they dont even come close to comparing to candlewood.

If you are interested in joining a private club do yourself a favor and look into candlewood.</Text>< date>

<text>First time coming across this place as I'm somewhat new to the area. I was really happy to discover an Italian restaurant in the neighborhood and grabbed some take out, however, my first experience was underwhelming. The breaded ravioli was decent but didn't seem very fresh, probably just microwaved. The pasta was a bit disappointing. It's hard to go wrong with pasta with oil and garlic but this one was bland and not at all tasty. The vegetable mix didn't go well together, maybe because of the overall bland taste and the fact that the dish was cold. The portion was also super small for the price and what it was. The bread was good, so there's that. I thought as I ate it might be a place I would try again, but then my stomach started feeling upset and I had to stop eating my meal. Now it's an hour later and I'm left super hungry. <Gmap_id>0x80ece30be05dc667:0x5b5a9f41d3021b93<//Gmap_id>< Review>
My wife and I went here for dinner. We are from out of town, but found the reviews favorable. The service was great, considering there was only one poor waitress for the whole dining room. She did a wonderful job despite her work load.

Food was delicious. We had a calzone and butternut squash, and neither disappointed us. Lots of flavor and quality ingredients made this a great meal.

The only negative on the experience was the decor. It could really use an upgrade, however I highly recommend this place.< /Review>

<userid>115868897361269458631< /userid>< name>
Timothy Chung< /name>
< Date>
1541714092141<//Date>
<rating>5<//rating>< text>
Quality italian cuisine that rivals small Italy!

I was there in this sleepy old Town and we came across this italian bistro, we ordered pesto spaghetti, Sunday gravy fettuccine, minestrone soup and fried cheese sticks, all with beverages only cost $40. But this restaurant provides far more value then fine diners and taste better. The minestrone soup we had a balance of taste of not exceedingly salty while all veggies are sufficiently cooked just to taste good. As their name suggested, spaghettis are their strength, and the Sunday gravy is a must try, looks like tomate with meat only, but far more then that. When you taste the sauce you can feel the herbs that came from the meat, not so much that it overtake the whole disc, able to keep it to the meat only, fettuccine is well cooked and had a light taste of olive, taste of all of them are in perfect balance, plus is hot enough so u will feel good. Never expect so much from such a humble restaurant!<//text>
<pics>None<//pics><response>None<//response><gmap_id>0x80ece30be05dc667:0x5b5a9f41d3021b93< /gmap_id></record>
</dataset><record>

<UserId.>108159019975003999731< /UserId.><Name>Devon Shearer<//Name><time>1526561789856<//time><rating>3</rating>< text>
I would love to give Jimmy Bumps 5 stars but I feel I would be misleading. The food is consistently good but not exceptional compared to other Italian restaurants in the county; however, it's excellent if you want to stay in the Los Osos/Morro Bay area. The service we have experienced each time is very borderline. The lead waitress/hostess can come off as though she's doing you a favor to wait on you, even to regular customers. She presents with a certain tone of indifference much of the time, and that type of reception is very off putting to the customers. I will say that the restaurant looks to be hiring more help. I hope the new staff bring a less abrupt vibe to the customers. One suggestion, if you like eggplant, order the eggplant parm. It's delicious!</text>

< Review>
John Calderon and his apprentice came to my rescue today! After a string of bad experiences with plumbers who were recommended to me or referred by my home warranty, I decided to venture out and find my own. Anderson Plumbing was the first to pop up and had the highest rating in San Diego. When I called, they answered immediately (last plumber hung up on me) and had someone at my door WITHIN AN HOUR (last plumber waited seven days before coming to my condo). John was so knowledgeable and friendly. (Both of them showed my dog lots of love, so bonus points there.) He was able to diagnose the problem immediately and even showed me the exact issue (so I knew he wasn‚Äôt just trying get me to replace a bunch of parts to drive up the cost). Although the fix was pricey, he was upfront about the cost and talked me through my options. They had the parts on hand to fix the water heater and waited until the hot water was running throughout the house before they left. Although larger companies can be a bit more expensive, it was 100% worth the extra money to use a reputable, legit company who came to my aid immediately and had a mini warehouse in their truck with everything they needed to fix the problem. Paying a couple extra bucks was worth avoiding the hassle I‚Äôve been experiencing with 2-star rated companies who took a week to get here in the first place. John converted me to a loyal customer and I will only use Anderson Plumbing in the future. Also - John spoke volumes about the owners of the company and how generous they are with their employees and are wonderful people to work for ‚Äî that‚Äôs the exact type of company I want to support!!< /Review>

<Date>1613842153239</Date>< pictures>
None< /pictures>
< review>
We've used Anderson's before with good results.  This time they sent a self-professed "drain" guy to install a new kitchen faucet on a Friday.  On Saturday, we discovered a large leak under the sink.  I called customer service and the first answer was "we like to have the responsible installer do the repair, is that alright?"  Uh, no, what part of large leak don't you understand?  Turned out the earliest they could get anyone out was Monday!  All weekend appointments were "booked".  As a VIP member I expected better service than this when the leak was caused by their installer.
The gentleman who came on Monday initially intended to charge me for the visit, but backed off when I explained (again) who had caused the issue.  He was competent and knowledgeable and fixed the problem to our satisfaction, but I still contend that I shouldn't have had to spend the weekend with a leak that was caused by their employee.  And next time, if there is a next time, please don't send a DRAIN guy to do a PLUMBER'S job. I also told the dispatcher to have a Supervisor call me on Monday to discuss (no supervisor available on weekend).  That never happened.  This is not what I call VIP service.

Edited based on the prompt response I received from Erin in CS. She took responsibility,  both personally and as a company, for the issues I identified and resolved the situation to my satisfaction.< /review>

<date>1616606847657<//date><rate>1</rate>< text>
While "Katy" was very professional in her demeanor and seems highly versed in the technical aspects of my furnace, I was surprised by the lack of specificity in the diagnoses. It could be this, this or this.  Which leads me to question, do service tech earn commission on repairs? In other words, the more parts and labor they sell, the bigger their paycheck?

Is this ethical?  Sadly, I ran into this same issue about a year or two ago with Anderson and my AC condenser. The repair estimate was $6K.  I ended up fixing it myself for $200 and it's worked perfectly ever since.

Today‚Äôs repair estimate  $1,788 + $68 for the service call. The parts, which I found online, are less than $285, and I question if they are both necessary. Labor time to replace these two suggested parts, or three suggested parts is 45 minutes for an experienced tech,  double for a novice.

With this second instance of what I believe are questionable at best business practices, and more likely unethical ones, obviously supported by management I will not use your company for any service or future sales.

UPDATE - March 2021
Apparently my review struck a nerve. Received a call and a full refund of my $68 service call fee. I still feel it‚Äôs a buyer beware situation, but I acknowledge the company did the right thing when they were called out.</text>

< username>
Garrett Dumas<//username>
< Review>
Despite my reluctance to deal with a huge plumbing service, I requested a plumber from Anderson to come out and evaluate why my bathroom sink drain continues to clog only 1-2 months after having it cleaned out. I was clear when booking the appointment that I did not want an 'unclog' service but for an actual plumber to come assess my issue.

Afternoon appointments are supposed to be from 12-4pm but the technician did not arrive until 5pm. When she arrived I explained what I was looking to do, just as I had explained it to the dispatcher. I proceeded to show her the issue and she removed the drawers from my bathroom sink in order to look at the plumbing.

After looking at the plumbing she indicated that she could clear the clog but it would happen again due to the drain. I explained that the purpose of the service call was to evaluate and take the steps needed to permanently resolve the issue and I was happy to replace all plumbing if needed to resolve this issue.

She continued to recommend that I have her fix the issue so the drain flows for ~$150, and have someone else come look at the drain with a camera. When I explained that I didn't want to spend $150 on a temporary fix when I was going to pay to replace the plumbing, the technician gave me attitude and left without reinstalling the drawers into my sink cabinet.

It has been difficult to get ahold of anyone at Anderson to resolve the issue. I have requested my money back and will use a different plumber to complete my project.</Review>

<rating>5</rating>< review>
I wish I could give Jacob and Humberto 10 stars instead of five!  I had a gigantic hot water leak in the slab of my home and called Anderson Plumbing to check it out.  After hearing a wide range of repair options and learning about the benefits of repiping the water system through the attic (no future slab leaks and no tearing up the floor!), I decide to go for the whole home repipe.  Jacob and Humberto started work the next morning and completed the pipe fitting within three days.  I was blown away by the quality, speed, accuracy and cleanliness of their work.  They communicated well with me, each other, and their main office so there were zero hiccups.  A huge bonus was that we had running, cold water and at least one restroom available at all times, until the last three hours when the system changed from old pipes to new. {'time': 1613771018626, 'text': 'Thank you Y. Song for your review and bringing to our attention your dissatisfaction. Our Client Relations Manager has reached out privately to address your concern.  We do hope to resolve the situation for you, please contact Erin, to discuss. Thank you, Anderson PHA'}< /response>
<userid>108036070830104909731<//userid><date>1613984028526</date>< review>
Update:
Erin, Anderson's Client Relations Manager reached out via email and explained their policy of flat rate per type of the job.  She offered 15% off on the water pressure regulator job and removed the charge for accessing the valve. While I recognize the effort to provide good customer care (along with multiple text, email and phone call asking for feedback)  I cannot say I'm remotely happy about this flat rate charge that's 3-4 time higher than being reasonable.

===========================================================
Anderson Plumbing's charge is absurdly high! I had a technician come to fix a leaky waterline going into the fridge. while doing that he also found the water pressure was high and I agreed to have the water pressure regulator replaced.

He had to cut a small hole on the drywall to access the pipe, which took him 30 seconds, and the charge is $323. Note this is only for cutting the hole, not including any repair work, and they will not fix the drywall afterwards. The actual repair work of replacing the water supply line's connection valve is another $323, which I'm ok with, since at least the technician spent 30 minutes on it.

The most ridiculous one is the $1,485 charge for replacing the water pressure regulator. The part is $180 according to the technician, and it's a quick job taking him literally less than 10 minutes using only a plumbers plier. I found out afterwards a reasonable cost for this should be in the $300 range including the part, and feel quite bad not doing enough research and being an informed customer beforehand. I wish everyone else considering calling them have the chance to read the reviews beforehand and be aware of their practice of overcharging to an outrageous extent.

I do agree that it was easy for me to make the appointment, and the technician came on time and finished the job quickly in a professional manner. But I'd not be able to recommend their services to anyone due to the extremely unreasonably high cost.<//review>

Sat 29 someone  calls in sick, will schedule Monday fine with us. ...Mon 31 a tech arrives but says he is her to do a complementary  camera inspection of our system.Never said specifically he was their to finish the job....estimate now $660+. <Resp>None</Resp>< review>
We had an old water heater that started leaking.  Anderson was able to come first thing the next day to give a free estimate.  We had several companies come out and provide us quotes to replace it with a gas tankless water heater.   Anderson came in at a reasonable price but the technician, Drew (Andrew), included additional incentives that persuaded us to go with them.  Drew had everything with him and was able to get us the appropriate water heater that same day.  He relocated and installed the water heater outside of our garage by the end of the day.   We were impressed by how efficient and clean he was with his work.  We had previous copper plumbing done in our home before and Drew was impressively quicker than the other guys.  He had to come back another day to finish up other work to our house but was equally as efficient and clean with his work.  He also set us up to have our drains scoped for free.  The technician, Brent, came out to scope our drains and was equally efficient, timely, and customer friendly.  I would highly recommend Anderson, Drew, and Brent for future plumbing/heating projects.<//review>

< text>
Worst ever customer service and plumbing knowledge. We called them for detecting a leak which had resulted in the floor flooding. The plumber came visited the house and charged us for the visit. The plumber had no clue, he could not detect the source and wrongly advised that the leak was coming from the bathroom upstairs. They charged us $365 for nothing and never send us a report. After multiple follow ups still till date no report has been given. We ended up calling another plumber who very quickly detected the leaking dishwasher at almost $100 cheaper. He also help fixed the leak and helped us with drying company and dishwasher company.

I would never use Andersen Plumbing ever again and advise everyone to stay away from them.

Subsequent to this review I had a very good follow up from Andersen and they have since rectified their response and have successfully resolved the matter to my satisfaction.

Thank you Andersen for prompt followup.</text>

<Name>Krishna Jagannathan<//Name><Time>1540607283995</Time><rating>5</rating><Text>I had issues with my heating, plumbing and air conditioning all on the same day. The representative that answered the phone when I called made sure I had an immediate appointment the next day and I was kept apprised of when the technician(s) would be arriving and also whether there was an earlier slot available so that I wouldn't have to wait.

All 3 of the technicians arrived on time and made me feel comfortable that they would resolve the problem.

Donald and Reggie, who handled the plumbing did a wonderful job! They explained everything to me and had me watch as they were doing the work. I have additional work to be done and they gave me options so that I could choose the most cost effective solution for my home and made an appointment to finish the work as soon as possible. Both were very competent, professional and personable and managed to resolve my issue, which gave me peace of mind.

The same was true for Mike, who handled my heating and air conditioning issues. He took the time to thoroughly diagnose and troubleshoot the problems and to make sure I was satisfied with his work before I left. I felt the pricing was reasonable given the fact that the work was warrantied by the company directly and none of them tried to pressure me into choosing a more expensive option. Reggie explained the rationale behind why it would be better to spend a little extra when it came to replacing two of the faucets in my bathroom.

All 3 left their contact info with me so I could reach them if there were any further problems and assured me that the company warranted their  work. They all also talked to me about the company's current promotions but didn't push me into going for any of them.

I just wanted to leave a review of the billing practices of Anderson Plumbing & Heating, that is the only portion of their work I find to be sub par.  We called them for a leaking toilet in a rental, they showed up at the appointed time and gave us the options of repairing or replacing.  We chose to replace and the work was completed on time and with what appears to be high quality.  My only complaint, the bill.  Parts and labor for an entirely new toilet was $518.98, reasonable.  The total bill was $1179, overhead & profit $660.02, which I think is too high.  They were contacted regarding the bill and they would not offer to cut any of the profit or overhead.<//Review>

<pics>None<//pics><GmapID>0x80d95825767feffd:0x9128f1cbf9c2d015< /GmapID><user_id>111895162016625706334<//user_id><Text>James B from Anderson is a fantastic plumber. I thought the drain from the toilet to the main line was blocked but he ran a few tests and determined the blockage was actually in the low-flow toilet itself. The problem was that the flush handle was not being held down long enough with the result that  the bowl was getting insufficient water so  toilet paper was not being pushed through the trap (located in the toilet) to the sewer pipe. On these low flow toilets you can't just press and release the handle- if you do the flapper valve will close prematurely. You must press and hold the handle down to keep the flapper valve open until all the water in the tank has entered the bowel.< /Text><Time>1537325674206</Time><user_name>James Christensen</user_name>< Rate>
5< /Rate>

<Rating>5<//Rating>< Review>
James Blacker saved us from a very challenging clog in our main sewer outlet. He tried twice to reach it through an undersized cleanout, hoping to save us the cost to remove and replace the toilet - but this old house would not give up the fight so easily. James then consulted with me and I agreed to remove the toilet to give him better access. James doggedly refused to give up until he had a tricky reclosing congestion fully cleared. This was not routine (nothing in our old house ever is), but James rose to the challenge.

He was professional and courteous and communicated pricing and expectations clearly and honestly at every stage. In the end, he left us feeling the service was top notch and the price paid quite reasonable.

Anderson is lucky to have James Blacker. So were we.</Review>

<text>When I first called Anderson Plumbing it was to fix the thermostat on my air conditioner. They told me that the unit was old (7 years old) and could not be replaced. That I would need to put in a new unit with new air conditioners. Having spent thousands of dollars with this company I figured that I had enough experience with them so that I could call them to fix a simple problem with the hot water in my shower. When they came I was told that I needed a new water softener unit for another few thousand dollars but my shower was fixed for the time being.
A couple of days later,when I had the same problem with the hot water in my shower, I made another appointment. At this appointment ,with another technician, I was told that I needed a different unit ,for another few thousand dollars, and the unit the first technician told me I needed wouldn't work. At this point I decided that I needed a second opinion from another company. In the meantime I found that the last guy they sent out had broken the hot cold water mixer on my shower. They escalated the problem to a repair supervisor who came out that week. He told me that they would have to replace the mixer on my shower, at no cost to me, and would call me in 2 days with an update as well as the exact cost of the new water softener unit he said I needed.
Two weeks later I still hadn't heard back from him. On the third week I received a message on my machine stating that the mixer had to be ordered from the manufacturer  and he would call me back the next day to discuss it. He had already tols me that it had to be replaced and I had foolishly assumed that he would do that first thing not three weeks later.
Three months later I still hadn't heard back from Anderson when I received an email message telling me it was time to make a service appointment on my air conditioners. I wrote back that I wouldn't be making any appointments with Anderson and to please remove me from their mailing list. That day I got a phone call from a very nice understanding lady who stated she was new to the job but that she was trying to straighten out problems that customer had had. She told me she would call Jose,the supervising technician who had come out the last time, and get back to me. True to her word she called me back the next day and informed me that she had ordered the part. She offered to call me every week to keep me updated which I declined.
Finally,after months, I got a call from her that the new part had come in and we made an appointment to install it.
The next time I tried to use my shower I found that only scalding hot water was coming out. No cold water to mix the hot water with. I called them to tell them what the situation was and she offered to send Jose back out to check on the problem. She informed me that since I had a tankless hot water system sometimes it took some time for the new unit to adjust. Now this explanation made no sense to me and if it makes sense to you then I'd suggest Anderson for your plumbing needs. It seems that in fixing one problem they always create a new one. To have them come out to try to fix it would be free but even at free it's far to expensive for me.
I wouldn't recommend Anderson to anyone  They're always   trying to sell you something new and can't seem to be able to do what they are hired to do correctly.
Stay far far away from this company.

Mark Schwartz</text><gmap_id>0x80d95825767feffd:0x9128f1cbf9c2d015< /gmap_id>< response>
None<//response>

<text>After a number of calls to various plumbing companies I got in contact with Anderson plumbing.  I had a leaking pipe and all companies were booked for the new week out or longer.  Anderson however took the time to check for any cancellations on a Friday and said they could have someone out later that afternoon. The area where our leak was had been over complicated with a number of bends and unused feed off points.  Ken replaced the copper piping and simplified the water flow for less stress on the piping. Steve Bates</name>
<Date>1535235701368< /Date>< rate>
5< /rate>
< review>
After a number of calls to various plumbing companies I got in contact with Anderson plumbing.  I had a leaking pipe and all companies were booked for the new week out or longer.  Anderson however took the time to check for any cancellations on a Friday and said they could have someone out later that afternoon.  My technician was Ken and he was super friendly and helpful with all the questions I had.  Our leak was in the attic and we have a tankless water system.  The area where our leak was had been over complicated with a number of bends and unused feed off points.  Ken replaced the copper piping and simplified the water flow for less stress on the piping.  He took the time to turn on all the faucets after repairs to flush all the air in the lines and showed me the new piping that he replaced to make sure he answered any questions I might have.  Anderson plumbing and Ken were very professional.  From talking to the booking agent on the phone to having all my questions answer to finding someone to come out so I didnt have to worry for an entire weekend.  Great company and I highly recommend them!!!!</review>

< text>
After a number of calls to various plumbing companies I got in contact with Anderson plumbing.  I had a leaking pipe and all companies were booked for the new week out or longer.  Anderson however took the time to check for any cancellations on a Friday and said they could have someone out later that afternoon.  My technician was Ken and he was super friendly and helpful with all the questions I had.  Our leak was in the attic and we have a tankless water system.  The area where our leak was had been over complicated with a number of bends and unused feed off points.  Ken replaced the copper piping and simplified the water flow for less stress on the piping.  He took the time to turn on all the faucets after repairs to flush all the air in the lines and showed me the new piping that he replaced to make sure he answered any questions I might have.  Anderson plumbing and Ken were very professional.  From talking to the booking agent on the phone to having all my questions answer to finding someone to come out so I didnt have to worry for an entire weekend.  Great company and I highly recommend them!!!!< /text>

<rate>5</rate><review>Smelled gas coming from beneath our stove, which is very alarming. Shut off the valve underneath, aired out the kitchen, but hours later still smelled a bit of gas. Called something like 5 different plumbers asking for help as I have three young kids in the house and a wife who is due to have our fourth ANY MINUTE! Very much a serious situation. Despite this, every plumber I called either didn't respond or they were too busy to help. Then, I realized a family member recently used Anderson and she gave me the name and number of the actual technician that helped her out so I gave them a call and asked for James by name.  They appreciated how urgent this situation was, and James came out right away. He and his teammate arrived and were pleasant to work with from the start. They were always professional, and obviously experts at what they do. Throughout the entire process they communicated with us frequently so we always knew what was going on, what progress they've made, what their recommendations are, and what options we had. They were also very clear and direct with the costs associated with each option, and we never felt pressured into paying some exorbitant amount for optional services. They worked hard the entire time, being very sensitive to my family's particular situation. After the gas leak was fixed, James came back a few more times in the following days to do further tests to make absolutely certain things were done right and that everything was still holding up after they made the repairs. He even came out personally to meet with underground leak detection services (a third party), spoke to city gas company on our behalf to get our gas turned back on, and worked directly with the city inspectors office to get all the appropriate inspections and paperwork in order. Now, my family has gas service again! More importantly, this means we have a working clothes dryer, furnace, and HOT WATER. < text>
Junior (technician) came to our home to evaluate our non functioning furnace. He was here several hours, and did great work in figuring out the problems, by replacing burned out circuit boards and other parts.  When he left the furnance was working.  He was concerned that something else might have been wrong. He called back in a few hours to check on its functioning, and by that time, it was not working correctly.  He had suggested we consider evaluating the need for a new furnance, since we were replacing so many parts.  We greatly appreciate his honesty and helpfulness with our whole situation.  We did in fact, talk to an Anderson advisor the next day, which helped us make the correct decision in replacing the furnace and original duct work.  We were unaware that the duct work was inefficient, and appreciated the information.
We now have a new furnace, with new duct work, which already appears to be more economical for us.
Thank you Anderson for employing great employees, like Junior, who was professional, courteous and very knowledgeable.</text>

<Rating>5<//Rating>< Review>
I called Anderson Plumbing to repair a bathroom sink drain that was leaking.  I also had several small plumbing related jobs that I really did not want to do myself so I decided to have them perform this work in addition to the repair.  I had never contacted a plumbing service before and decided on Anderson Plumbing because they have been in business for so long and had a great rating with the BBB.  I can honestly say that it was a pleasure working with this company.  The phone representatives are polite and courteous.  The technician showed up on time, treated my home with care, and conducted himself in a professional manner.  The visit started with a walk through and discussion about the work to be performed, some Q&A, full disclosure of the charges (the forms they use are very detailed), and lastly a time estimate to complete the work.  The plumber, Reggie, did a wonderful job.  When he finished we performed another walk-through to review the repairs.  He answered all of my questions and provided some helpful tips.  I would definitely use this company again.< /Review>

<user>105146965542274792337<//user><user_name>Bill Hoffman< /user_name><date>1515113602635</date><rating>5<//rating>< Review>
We called Anderson Plumbing because we had a slab leak.  Erik Egerstrom,  the plumbing technician came out in a timely manner.  He spent a lot of time looking for the leak and explaining everything to us.  He recommended that we call a leak detection company, which we did.  He followed up with us, and came out to give us a quote on repair.  He worked with us on pricing and was very professional and honest about what we needed and didn't need.  When he came to do the work, he and his apprentice got here at 9:30 AM and worked until 10:30 PM  because he wanted to make sure we had water for the weekend.  He then followed up after the weekend and finished the rest of the work.  Erik was professional, very knowledgeable and best of all honest!!  The drywaller and office staff were wonderful as well.  Thank you Anderson!!</Review>

<user>112465427891732455571< /user><Name>Denise Lisa< /Name><time>1538511317656< /time>< Rating>
5<//Rating>
< Review>
Ron, the plumber was great! . I told him the property was in the middle of selling and we needed this I spection for the buyers today. We had requested a non intrusive camera scope to verify if there was a leak or moisture inside the wall. When he walked in empty handed I asked if he had the camera with him, he replied no, then I went off and reacted terribly.  Even though I was a l irrate, he remained calm.  I told him the owner specifically requested it when she ordered them to come out.  He immediately called his office to see what the issue was and found out that for some reason, whomever took the appointment did not put that in the call notes.
He calmly recommended some options of cutting into the wall and what that cost would be, or would have to wait until the plumber with the scope could be scheduled. We decided to remove a piece of drywall ourselves so he could look in and he thoroughly inspected the area visually and what he couldn't see he stuck his arm in the wall to feel around for any water or dampness. He was gracious the entire time and explained everything so clearly and calmed me down.  He also wrote up the findings on his tablet and emailed it directly to us while he was still on site. What a fantastic man and employee you have!  Sincerely, Denise Lisa, the owners realtor. I will definitely recommend your company to all of my clients. However please make sure your schedulers understand what the client is asking for, what type of plumber they need and write everything the customer requested, verbatim, in the remarks!</Review>

<Rating>5<//Rating>< Text>
Had problem with a toilet wobbling and leaking water from under base.  Problem was caused by previous plumber incorrectly setting a new toilet in place by trying to use two wax seals to make up for the flange being lower and not flush with the finished tile floor level.  Alex installed a new flange, level with the finished floor, and a new wax seal and then set the new toilet in place, using shims to eliminate any wobbling, and finally caulked around the entire base.  Alex was professional, courteous, and explained fully what he had to do, what the cost would be before he proceeded, then did the work and thoroughly cleaned up after himself when the work was completed.  will certainly use the company again if and when the need arises.< /Text>

< rating>

<Review>I used Anderson for their plumbing services and I was satisfied with that work.  Despite being over priced, I liked both of the technicians who came to my house.  However, I am EXTREMELY dissatisfied with HVAC services that I received.  The technician came to my house and instead of assessing all possible options (which I later learned there were other, cheaper options), he went straight to the $1300 blower motor option, which knowing nothing about HVAC, I figured that was what was needed.  The technician installed the blower motor and it worked for less than 24 hours.  Anderson came back and this time brought back a salesman who tried to pressure me into spending 9-10 THOUSAND dollars on a completely new system.  I felt very uncomfortable about the sales tactics and I could tell that my technician was also uncomfortable.  Eventually the salesperson left and the technician agreed to try a simple remedy, adding refrigerant to the system.  They were originally going to try to charge me $200 for this, but decided to spare me the expense.  The system worked for only a few hours.  I eventually changed the outlet and that got the system working for a couple of weeks.

It broke again, and after talking to other professionals in the area and my family friend back at home about it, they explained that I was completely ripped off and completely overcharged for something that failed to work.  They also explained that the prices that they were quoting me for a new system were completely absurd.  I feel completely taken advantage of; the company realized that my spouse and I were not savvy in the HVAC realm and they pounced on the opportunity to make as much money from us as possible.

I ultimately hired a new professional to fix my broken system and they explained that the motor that was installed by Anderson had already broke and also that there were other fixes to try prior to replacing the blower motor originally.  I tried to get some or all of my money back from Anderson, but they were very difficult to reach, have given me the runaround, and refuse to do anything because I did not give them the opportunity to fix the problem.  I explained that I know that they took advantage of me and that I was uncomfortable with their sales tactics and they just choose to slander the professional that I used to fix the problem and try to affix the blame on me in any way possible.

If you cannot tell, I am completely dissatisfied with the assistance that I received from Anderson and I will never use them ever again and will be sure to tell anyone who will listen to never use them again.  They just want your money and will pretend to be helpful and charming in an attempt to get you to trust them and spend all kinds of money on things that you do not need.

**Update**
Erin and her team helped resolve the issue and I am grateful that she took the time to reach out to me to see what was going on and make sure that we were taken care of.</Review>< Pictures>

< name>
Keith Sullivan<//name>
< review>
Contacted Anderson Plumbing for a slab leak. Brian was the tech that came out, and he gave us a recommendation and the cost. Did a copper re-rout that led to the kitchen. A week later another copper pipe leak showed up in a different area. Requested that Brian come back out to investigate. Found a pin hole leak in the copper pipe which he spot repaired to stop the leak. Based on the two leaks we discussed a full copper re-pipe of the house. We decided to go this route as we have been spared of water damage up to this point. We requested that Brian do the work. Brian does excellent work. He plans things out, does not rush, keeps the house clean by using plastic around the work area, and makes sure we have use of some running water while replacing the old piping. At this time (because all the plumbing was being disconnected) we replaced a toilet  and some tub and shower valves. This was a big job and we appreciate Brian's dedication. If by chance some plumbing needs to be done in the future I will request Brain as the one to repair it.</review>

< text>
Drina was excellent tech in doing HVAC checkup. She's conscientious and relentless.

Anderson's will be returning, because they were unable to resolve one problem today. One anticipates that their depth of talent will enable them to identify the right person rapidly and be able to schedule quickly, since it's a follow-up and it's taking a good bit of extra customer time.

This is a costly problem for those customers who have businesses, for example, and can readily multitask with emails, but are unable to justify the various costs imposed by unnecessary phone calls. <review>Larry was very courteous, answered my questions and tried to trouble shoot the problem.    He was on time, respected my property.  What he did not do was remove the trap.  I did not ask him to but when he ran water and could not reproduce the back up of water in the sink, he might have thought of that.  I thought of it later the night and asked the next person who looked at the sink when it backed up again to do that.  We found a child's toothbrush which had obviously been in there for some time.  I am not faulting him but the next time I would definitely make sure the trap be removed from a sink that is backing up.

I also had Zak B. out for the same problem.  Again he ran water, tried to reproduce the blockage.  We went over everything that had been done the day before, we checked the clean out on the side of the building and then I asked him to remove the trap on the sink.  He did and we found a child's toothbrush in the trap.  Again if I had not asked to have it removed the problem would have recurred.  I am happy I asked but I think the technician should know to remove a trap if they can't reproduce the blockage with running water.  Something has to be causing the sink to backup several times.< /review>< Pictures>

<review>I called Anderson to have a broken disposer replaced. Calling the job in already a great experience - ''How can I make you smile today?'' just works! Scheduling was without problems and I got called 30 minutes before the technician arrived. Justin M. impressed me right away, because he listened to my problem description, then assessed the work involved, presented me with the options available. I chose, he did the rest - a sizable job as it turned out. In-between and after having finished, he warned me that, perhaps, another unrelated problem might arise in the near future. He counseled me on the work to be done, if that were the case. Justin explained everything very well. He also asked me if there were other problems and, on me mentioning one, he took care of it. The parts that he needed were on the Anderson truck - they are fully stocked as the advertisement says. Justin left the job site clean and tidy. The part that he had mentioned might be on the brink of failure actually did fail a few hours later. I called it in, the time was set and Justin took care of the rusted out part the next day, same time. No fuzz, no huff and puff, Anderson and Justin just did it. I had used this company before, and was happy, but it has gotten even better!< /review><pictures>None< /pictures>< response>

<Time>1501022984115< /Time><rating>5<//rating><review>Tried Anderson Plumbing, Heating, and Air for the first time. Having only one full bath, it was a bit of an emergency when the shower wouldn't drain, and dripping faucets were rapidly filling the shower stall. Technician James, attempted to clear the blockage, but only got 2 feet into the drain. After informing him of old cast iron pipes in the crawl space beneath our house, he called a camera specialist, Ricardo, to determine the problem. We needed a new trap and 10 foot length of modern-day "code" pipe. James was able to temporarily stop the dripping faucets. Unfortunately, we weren't able to schedule the fix-up for a week later.

One week later: Larry, a very knowledgeable man with plenty of on-the-job experience, and a supervisor as well, arrived about 8:30 AM (on time), fully explained all of the work that was to be done, and answered all of our questions. Then he went right to work. The beneath the house work was accomplished pretty quickly, but the new, Moen, single handle faucet kit was a bit of a challenge. Larry had to remove an area of tile, and saw through 2-inch concrete and lathe in our "vintage" shower stall. When the job was completed (by mid-afternoon), the shower drained well (with its modern, 4 inch pipe), and we had a shiny Moen faucet/plate and shower head. They were so well-installed that one couldn't tell that they were replacements. No damage to the existing tile and well-sealed.

On the same-day that James and Ricardo came out, (at different times), I was only charged $42. Ricardo prepared the cost, with options. In my opinion, the fee for the option that I chose, was fair, considering the time, labor, and parts involved. On repair day, no attempt to oversell, no surprises. My white tiled bathroom was left clean, and undamaged. Larry even wore shoe covers to protect my dark hardwood floors and oriental rugs where he had to pass through the house.

I definitely will call Anderson again for its caring, knowledgeable, experienced, professional service for plumbing repairs on my OLD house. Thank you, James, Ricardo, and Larry.</review>< Pictures>

What a waste of VIP membership. This place sucks with all the good reviews above failed to response when I needed the most. This should say a lot when you have to chose your next plumbing project or problems.

Richard Roque<//review><pics>None< /pics><response>{'time': 1530905589998, 'text': '***RESOLVED*** We were able to provide Mr. Roque with the necessary information for him to contact the city regarding his issue. Thank you Mr. Roque for working with me to get this taken care of for you. We hope that your situation gets handled, please let us know if there is anything further you need.\n\nThank you Mr. Roque for your review and bringing to our attention your dissatisfaction with your call out to us. My name is Erin, I am our Client Care Manager here at Anderson PHA. I was able to pull up your account and research the details. First I would like to apologize that we were not able to get out to you sooner, we were very busy due to the Holiday, and we sincerely apologize that you had to call another company out. We are very glad I was an easy clearing for you. Our intentions are to be able to get to every client that needs us, unfortunately that isn\'t the case always.\nI also was able to get information on the estimate given for the camera and report requested. Our normal camera charge is $250.00, and an additional fee to place findings on a flash drive for your records. However, when a client needs a "Plumbers Report" there is more to just the camera-ing of the line. Because the city will not take the report from a homeowner, only a licensed plumber- our technicians have to camera the line, place the findings on a disc, write up an official findings report, take these to the city and file the report along with their form- this is why the price increased. I was also informed that the city will not do anything regarding roots in the line, corrosion or build up. There has to actually be a break, or collapse in the line for them to come out and repair/replace. If the line is able to be hydro-jetted to clear out roots or buildup- they will expect the homeowner to take care of this at their expense. I hope this gives a little more insight to your concern. I know it doesn\'t help that we were not available sooner to come out, please call me directly if you have another issue and I will work directly with a technician for you.\n\nSincerely,\nErin Hanson\nClient Care Manager\n619-449-3852\nAnderson PHA\nerinh@andersonpha.com'}< /response>< gmap_id>

<Review>I did not have a good experience with this company. I had them out to move a gas line and repair a leak coming from one of the fixtures in the upstairs bathtub. I usually try and stay home when people are working on the house for supervision and to answer questions, but this time I couldn't. Upon arriving home after work I found a 1 ft by 2 ft hole in the bathroom ceiling that was in the room adjacent to where the gas line was being moved and I received a message saying that I could not use my bathroom shower as the pipe below had been cracked. I do realize things happen on a jobsite, but this was a bit ridiculous. And to top it off, when I reached out to the plumber for clarification, he stated it was my fault and that I would have to pay to get everything fixed. He said he would "work with me" on the price but that he is "covered and took pictures." Being in the medical field, I liken this to a surgeon repairing a ACL, but in the meantime cutting the MCL. Apparently the gas line had fallen when he cut it which caused the hole in the spare bathroom ceiling and when he was unscrewing the drain plug, he broke the pipe below. After much argument, the plumber did agree to fix the pipe that was broke but I had to supply all of the parts and the hole in the ceiling I would have to fix. Overall, if you want your house to be in worse shape after you pay $1500, call this company.

After my review for this company I noticed that they had responded with a "we do not have you in our records, please call this number." I proceeded to call this number and express my concerns with their work. After leaving a message and waiting 2 weeks, I have now determined this must be an automated message by the company and this "we do not have your records on file" is a way to make them look like they care. Bad all around!!!< /Review>< pictures>

< userid>
105195650982475930255< /userid>
< Name>
Bernard Hernandez<//Name>
<time>1461794267049<//time>< Rate>
5<//Rate>
< Review>
This was my second experience with Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air.  I was having issues with my upstairs bathroom sinks not draining.  I tried to fix it myself, but to no avail.  I decided to call Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air because my previous experience with them was an excellent one.  I called a little later in the evening and was pleasantly surprised  that someone was there to take my call.  I was greeted with a warm, "Thank you for calling Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air, how can I make you smile today?!"  What a nice way to greet your customers!  Right away, you know that you are going to be taken care of.  I was easily able to schedule an appointment.  The first appointment offered was on a Sunday.  That is so great that they could send someone over the weekend.  I knew I wasn't going to be home on Sunday so I made the appointment for the early 8-12pm window on Monday.  Usually when a company gives you a window of time, you can usually count on them coming at the end of the time, if not much later.  This is really inconvenient when you have to take half a day off of work just to wait for a technician.  Not the case with Anderson.  I got a call at 8am saying that the tech would arrive by 9am.  And he arrived by 9am!  Larry introduced himself, shook my hand, and asked for permission to enter my house.  Before he entered, he put on his booties without being asked.  After I explained my plumbing issue to him, he clearly explained what actions he needed to do and explained in detail what the cost was going to be.  I asked Larry if he would mind if I watched so I can learn how to fix a clog in the future.  He said, "Sure" and proceeded to educate me and explain step by step what he was doing and why and how the plumbing worked.  He was happy to do it and appeared genuinely proud of the work he was doing.  Many techs want to be left alone and don't want to be bothered.  Turned out that my drain issue was a bit complex.  Larry used his industrial auger, which put my 20 ft hand auger to shame.  When that did not work, be broke out the beast auger and that fixed the issue.  Despite having to go back and forth to the van to get supplies, despite having to go up and down and stairs, inside and outside the house, Larry stayed calm and collected, didn't mind removing and putting back on his booties.  When he finished his work upstairs, he cleaned up the entirety of his work area and then some.  He sprayed down the counters and glass with cleaner and he made sure he left the bathroom area nicer than when he arrived.  He even thanked me for my help, even though I was there observing to learn from him.  Larry recapped everything that he did, explained the warranty of his work, and made some recommendations without being one bit pushy or salesy.  I was so impressed by Larry's work ethic, professionalism, integrity, and passion for his craft.  Coincidentally, that day was "National Hug a Plumber Day".  To show my appreciation, I offered Larry a tip so that he can buy lunch or whatever.  He graciously said, "No thank you, it was my pleasure to serve you, use that to take your kids out to lunch."  What a great guy!

The next day, based on Larry's recommendation, William came over with his nifty video device.  In order to make sure that there were no other issues with my pipes, William fished his video camera down into my pipes.  We were able to clearly see inside the pipes, maybe 20 feet or so.  This was displayed on the video monitor.  When he was done, William said everything looked good, there was no additional blockage.  He recommended hydrojetting (washing) of the pipes, but at this point it was not an emergency, but should be done at some point in order to avoid future clogs.  I appreciated his honesty when he could have easily tried to upsell me.

This is a testament to what a great company Anderson is.  Built upon family values, they really take the time and effort to show that they care and appreciate their customers.  If you have any plumbing, heating or air issues, I recommend Anderson without reservation!< /Review>

None</pictures>

<rating>1</rating>< review>
I needed some minor plumbing/fixture work done on my home to get it ready for a home inspection.  My typical plumber did not have availability within the time frame.  I remembered the AWSOME trucks I had seen around, and being a professional female myself, I thought I'd give them a try. Calling and scheduling the appointment was great--super professional without a long wait for service. The service charge was extremely reasonable as well. The guy arrived on time and was really nice.
Before entering the house, I showed him a water spicket that had a stripped handle on it. He said he would look at it before he left but it would be expensive (odd  I thought). One of the jobs was to have a "sticky" diverter (from bath to shower) loosened because it was gritty and difficult to manipulate.   No parts, not major work.  Problem:  the quote to have that done was $550!  Really.  $550.    I declined and showed him another bath tub  where the water stopper was not attached to the Kohler lever so the water would not drain.  He did not know how to fix the Kohler but suggested a toe tap drain.   This, I had to do because I needed it for an inspection. The charge: $330.  Really.  It took him 5 minutes.
He overheard me on the phone telling my real estate agent that the charge was too expensive and he apologized  stating that he didn't set the prices, he only enforced them.

After he left, I got a squirt bottle with vinegar and soaked and manipulated the gritty diverter.  Works just fine.  Really, Really disappointed.< /review>

<GmapID>0x80d95825767feffd:0x9128f1cbf9c2d015</GmapID><review>Russel and John got tasked to correct a difficult Return Air ducting issue with a new install of a Lennox 4 ton HVAC unit in an older existing structure. The original Return ducting consisted of a single 12" round duct. The unit needed at least 1500 cfm, when it only had 600 cfm. I thought we could get another through the lower story into the mechanical room, but only a 6" was able to be installed due to framing and other mechanical systems interference. The solution,  since I did not want the exterior of the structure opened up, was to have the service tech, Russel, crawl up through a small opening in the ceiling of the outside mechanical room; upwards through a 2 story chase, in order to remove the existing 12" and cut in another 12' round to double that capacity. Both Russel and John never hesitated when evaluating the job. They jumped right in, finished in a remarkably short time, made the connections in extremely tight areas, worked cleanly and neatly. The A/C unit now produces the full 4 ton capacity with no problem. Kudos to these guys for their work and extremely positive attitudes, and know how; to be able to get a difficult remodel situation solved.
Thanks Guys.</review><Time>1457905270398<//Time>< Rating>

<Text>I contacted SDG& E about a gas smell in my foyer.  They came out and found no gas readings in the home yet checked out the system and found it was changing pressure enough to warrant a complete gas turnoff and lock.  That was on June 2nd.  That same evening I contacted Anderson Plumbing on the web and was contacted that same evening to schedule a technician to come out.

Chris B was very professional.  He and his associate went through the system thoroughly and methodically assessing the situation.  Unfortunately, with this older structure finding the problem was difficult.  But through a process of elimination, Chris was able to narrow it down to an single location and had a theory on the possible issue.  He then proceeded to let me know of the delay in completion do to the fact that he wanted to be sure and not demo my home any more by using a helium test to pinpoint the problem.

The next day the problem area was found and the repairs were down quickly.  Unable to get the County to move faster they were not able to come out on Friday to sign off on this.  The whole weekend was a "no Hot Water"  weekend.

On Monday we got the County Inspector(if you can call him that.)  He immediately treated you staff as if they we amature Craigslist Handymen.  Telling them they did the repair all wrong and used the wrong hardware and proceeded in accusing Chris of not being "qualified"  to do the work because he didn't have a certification card.  He even said this work wasn't finished,  made them change a flex line in the furnace to a hard line( not why he was here by the way) and walked out as Chris tried to explain to him where was mistaken and that he is a professional at his work.  Chris was then, after at least 15 minutes convinced the inspector that he was right.  The inspector basic conditionally approved the turn-on.  And wanted Chris to return to shut off everything later this week so he can come back out and inspect the fixes himself and the pressure reading as well.  Preposterous Crap!

Well Chris got the job done and he and his associate(sorry I for got his name) was supurb, and after six days my wife can now washer her hair.  That's all that matters.

Thanks Chris
Thanks Anderson.

Duke Windsor</Text><UserId.>101710333835274876434<//UserId.>< pics>
